item.description: Needles Exits on I-40 west. The next two exits are J St. and West Broadway/River Road. Sign in background directs Bullhead City (Arizona) traffic to use the J St. exit.

item.description: I-40 west at Exit 148 - To US-95 South/Blythe. The US-95 shield is displayed as text on this sign. This exit serves File Mile Road, and provides a cutoff between I-40 and US-95 south.

item.description: I-40 west approaching the California State Agricultural Inspection Station at Needles. All traffic has to stop for inspection.

item.title: I-40 West - Entering Pacific Time
item.description: Entering Pacific Time on I-40 west. Arizona does not observe daylight savings time, so during the summer months Arizona and California are on the same time.

item.title: I-40 West Approaching Exit 153
item.description: I-40 west approaching Exit 153 - Park Moabi Road. This is the first exit on I-40 inside California westbound.

item.description: Welcome to California on I-40 west at the Arizona-California state line crossing the Colorado River. San Bernardino County line.

item.description: I-40 west approaching Exit 48 - US-93/To AZ-68/Beale st./Las Vegas. AZ-68 leaves US-93 north of Kingman and connects to Bullhead City, Arizona and Laughlin, Nevada.

item.description: I-40 west at Exit 51 - Stockton Hill Road.

item.title: End AZ-66 At I-40/US-93
item.description: End AZ-66 West at I-40/US-93 Jct. Historic Loop US-66 continues west through downtown Kingman.

item.title: End AZ-66 West At I-40/US-93
item.description: End AZ-66 west at I-40/US-93 jct. Use I-40 West/US-93 North for Los Angeles and Las Vegas. Use I-40 East/US-93 South for Phoenix and Flagstaff. Continue straight for Andy Devine Avenue and Historic Loop US-66.

item.title: I-40 West at AZ-66
item.description: I-40 west at AZ-66 (and Historic Loop US-66) at Exit 53 onramp. Use AZ-66 east for Peach Springs and Kingman Airport.

item.title: I-40 West - Exits 53 and 51
item.description: I-40 west at Exit 53 - Historic Loop US-66/AZ-66 East/Andy Devine Ave./Kingman Airport. Approaching Exit 51 - Stockton Hill Road.

item.title: For Historic US-66 Use Exit 53
item.description: For Historic US-66 to Peach Springs use Exit 53. The Arizona Scenic Byway symbol is on the top left of this sign. Historic US-66 through Arizona between Topock and Ash Fork is called the Historic Route 66 National Scenic Byway.

item.title: I-40 West - Kingman Exits
item.description: Kingman exits on I-40 west: Historic Loop US-66/AZ-66/Andy Devine Ave., Stockton Hill Road, US-93 Beale St.

item.title: I-40 West Approaching Exit 53
item.description: I-40 west approaching Exit 53 - Historic Loop US-66/AZ-66 East/Andy Devine Ave./Kingman Airport.

item.title: I-40 West - AZ-68 Traffic Use Exit 48
item.description: AZ-68 traffic for Bullhead City, and Laughlin (Nevada), use Exit 48. This sign is posted on the east end of Kingman approaching Exit 53.

item.title: I-40 West Approaching Exit 59
item.description: I-40 west approaching Exit 59 - DW Ranch Road.

item.title: I-40 West Approaching Exit 66
item.description: I-40 west approaching Exit 66 - Blake Ranch Road.

item.title: US-93 North at I-40
item.description: US-93 north at I-40. US-93 north joins I-40 west through Kingman.

item.title: US-93 North at I-40
item.description: US-93 north at I-40. Use I-40 West/US-93 north for Kingman/Los Angeles/Las Vegas. Use I-40 east for Flagstaff. US-93 north joins I-40 west through Kingman.

item.title: US-93 North Approaching I-40
item.description: US-93 north approaching I-40, one-half mile.

item.title: I-40 East Exit 26 offramp at NM-118
item.description: I-40 east Exit 26 offramp at NM-118/BL-40. NM-118 is the route of former US-66.

item.title: I-40 East Offramp at BL-40/NM-118
item.description: I-40 east offramp at BL-40/NM-118. Use NM-118 east for Army Depot. Rehoboth, and and Red Rock Park.

item.title: I-40 East at Exit 26 Offramp
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 26 Offramp. Turn right for State Police; turn left for Gallup and Hospital.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 26
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 26 - BL-40/NM-118/East Gallup. This is the eastern end of the Gallup business loop.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 26
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 26 - BL-40/NM-118/E. 66 Ave. The actual exit text is for East Gallup.

item.title: I-40 West Approaching Exit 22
item.description: I-40 west approaching Exit 22 - Miyamura Drive/Montoya Blvd.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 20
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 20 - Downtown Gallup. The advance signs to Exit 20 are much more detailed then the actual exit name, which is Munoz Blvd.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 20
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 20 - US-491/NM-602/Shiprock/Zuni. The advance signs to Exit 20 are much more detailed then the actual exit name, which is Munoz Blvd.

item.title: NM-118 East at I-40 East Onramp
item.description: NM-118 east at I-40 east onramp, at Exit 16. Use I-40 east for Albuquerque.

item.title: BL-40/NM-118 West at I-40 West
item.description: BL-40/NM-118 west at I-40 west to Flagstaff. This is the western end of the Gallup business loop.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 16
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 16 - BL-40/NM-118/West Gallup.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 16
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 16 - NM-118/BL-40/West Gallup. Use Exit 16 for BL-40/West Gallup/Historic US-66 Route.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 16
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 16 - BL-40/NM-118/West Gallup.

item.title: Distance Marker on I-40 East
item.description: Distance marker on I-40 east. Distance to US-491, Gallup, and Albuquerque.

item.title: NM-118 West at I-40 East
item.description: NM-118 west at I-40 east (Exit 8) onramp. Continue west on NM-118 for westbound I-40 access.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 8
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 8. Eastbound, Exit 8 has no advanced signage, just the Exit 8 gore sign. Westbound, Exit 8 is signed as Manuelito/Defiance. Exit 8 is the first New Mexico exit eastbound on I-40. This exit connects to NM-118, which serves as a frontage road to I-40.

item.title: I-40 East - Distance Marker
item.description: First distance marker inside New Mexico on I-40 eastbound. Distance to Gallup, Grants, and Albuquerque.

item.title: I-40 East - Welcome To New Mexico
item.description: Welcome to New Mexico - The Land of Enchantment on I-40 eastbound.

item.title: I-40 East - New Mexico State Line
item.description: New Mexico State Line on I-40 east.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 359
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 359 - Grants Road. This is the last Arizona exit on I-40 eastbound.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 359
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 359. Use Exit 359 for Historic US-66.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 357
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 357 - Navajo IR-12 North/Window Rock. Window Rock is the capitol of the Navajo Nation.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 354
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 354 - Hawthorne Road.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 351
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 351 - Allentown Road.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 348
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 348 - Houck.

item.title: I-40 Onramp at Exit 346
item.description: I-40 onramp at Exit 346. Use I-40 west for Flagstaff; use I-40 east for Albuquerque.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 346
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 346 - Pine Springs Road.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 343
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 343 - Querino Road.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 341
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 341 - Ortega Road.

item.title: I-40 East - Entering Navajo Nation
item.description: Entering the Navajo Nation on I-40 east.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 339
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 339 - US-191 South/St. Johns. US-191 south leaves I-40 eastbound at Exit 339.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 333
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 333 - US-191 North/Ganado. US-191 south joins I-40 eastbound for six miles.

item.title: I-40 East/US-191 South
item.description: I-40 East/US-191 south in Apache County, Arizona. The US-191 shield is actually in error, because US-191 does not join I-40 eastbound for another 3 miles.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 320
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 320 - McCarrell Road.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 325
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 325 - Navajo.

item.description: Distance marker on I-40 east to Jct. US-191 North, Jct. US-191 South, and Albuquerque.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 320
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 320 - Pinta Road.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 311
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 311 - Petrified Forest National Park.

item.title: I-40 East - Entering Apache County
item.description: Entering Apache County on I-40 east.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 303
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 303 - Adamana Road.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 300
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 300 - Goodwater.

item.title: I-40 East Approaching Exit 294
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 294 - Sun Valley Road.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 292
item.description: I-40 east at Exit 292 - AZ-77 North/Keams Canyon. AZ-77 north leaves I-40 here, and heads north onto the Hopi Indian Reservation.

item.title: I-40 East - Exit 289
item.description: I-40 east approaching Exit 289 - BL-40/Navajo Blvd.

item.title: I-40 East Shield
item.description: I-40 East, Arizona, shield in Holbrook.

item.title: BL-40 East/AZ-77 North at I-40
item.description: BL-40 East/AZ-77 North at I-40 freeway entrance. Use I-40 west for Flagstaff; use I-40 east for Albuquerque. AZ-77 joins I-40 east through Holbrook.

item.title: BL-40 East/AZ-77 North at I-40
item.description: BL-40 East/AZ-77 North at I-40 freeway entrance. Use I-40 west for Flagstaff; use I-40 east for Albuquerque. AZ-77 joins I-40 east through Holbrook.

item.title: BL-40 East/AZ-77 North Approaching I-40
item.description: BL-40 East/AZ-77 North approaching I-40. AZ-77 joins I-40 east through Holbrook.

item.title: AZ-77 North/BL-40 East Approaching I-40
item.description: AZ-77 North/BL-40 East approaching I-40. AZ-77 north joins I-40 east to the east side of Holbrook.

item.title: AZ-77 North To I-40
item.description: AZ-77 north to I-40 (and US-180 west which is not signed) in Holbrook.

item.title: AZ-77 North at US-180
item.description: AZ-77 north at US-180. Turn right for US-180 east; continue north on AZ-77 for US-180 east to I-40.

item.title: End AZ-377 at AZ-77
item.description: End AZ-377 at AZ-77. Use AZ-77 north for I-40.

item.title: AZ-377 North To I-40
item.description: AZ-377 north to I-40. Many of the shields along AZ-277 and AZ-377 north between Heber and Holbrook have a To I-40 shield in addition to the state highway shield.

item.description: AZ-260 west at AZ-277 north (To AZ-377 and I-40).

item.description: AZ-260 east at AZ-277 north. Use AZ-277 north for AZ-377 and I-40.
